result.execSummary:
The defendant Amelia R Mcdowell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Clinical evalution for any other recommended treatment.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
-Court has no objection to early termination of probation but leaves it up to the agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amelia R Mcdowell

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
9:18 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Max Saylor.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to the charge with probation.  State concurs.  Defendant concurs.  Atty Saylor concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing argument by Atty Saylor.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 12 months.

CONDITIONS:

Court costs.
-20 hours of community service.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Clinical evalution for any other recommended treatment.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court has no objection to early termination of probation but leaves it up to the agent.

Court adjourned at 9:26 a.m.

1:59 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Max Saylor.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by tty Saylor, has an agreement and requests a plea & sentencing date.  Court sets for plea & sentencing on November 30, 2015 at 9:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 2:00 p.m.

Atty Max Saylor called, was just retained and requests the Status hearing on 09/22 be set out for Status Hearing on another date.  Atty Saylor to submit a Notice of Retainer.
43
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

8:42 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant stands mute.  Court enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court will set for Status Hearing on September 22, 2015 at 9:15 a.m.

Court adjourned at 8:43 a.m.
